title: Please suggest sans-serif font for headers to compliment ITC New Baskerville body.
content:
I’m using ITC New Baskerville at 11 points for the body of a bible-related study guide. I want this guide to have a fresh, clean, professional look. Originally I was torn between Mercury and ITC New Baskerville, and eventually opted for the latter when I saw it effectively used in a book.

Now I need a good sans-serif font to be used for headers to compliment this work.

I’ve been working in Word and was originally using Arial Black at 20 points. But lately I’m totally turned off by the Microsoft licensed fonts.

A professional logo was recently created for this work, and the designer used Neue Helvetica 73 Bold Extended in all caps for the logo. So originally I investigated that font using both lower and upper case letters. The headers in my book will use mixed case.

The width of Neue Helvetica 73 Bold Extended is nice. But the white space in some lower case letters (like a, e, and s) is unsatisfactory. I read the thread regarding Helvetica and Univers, and it seems the latter is favored by designers ( [http://typophile.com/node/33301](http://web.archive.org/web/20090806054323/http:/typophile.com/node/33301 "http://typophile.com/node/33301")). After comparing Univers 73 Black Extended with the former I agree that Univers is superior to Helvetica.

All that being said, I’m not married to any header font at this point. The extended fonts seem to contrast nicely with ITC New Baskerville.

The qualities I’m looking for are:  
1. High contrast  
2. Readability  
3. Clean professional appearance

Please recommend some fonts that you think would compliment ITC New Baskerville. Thanks.
author: KenPalmer

comments.content: I wonder about one of your requirements. The serif face you are working with is already high in contrast. Wouldn’t it be a nice counterpoint to use something with little to no contrast?
Thanks Miss Tiffany. That’s why I’m asking the experts. :) What would you suggest?

How well do you think any of these would work as header text for ITC New Baskerville body text?  
\* Antenna Black  
\* Titling Gothic Normal Bold  
\* Gotham Ultra  
\* Akzidenz Grotesk BQ Super

I like all of these. Thanks.

My personal opinion is that of these four options, Gotham (Ultra) works best, and Antenna Black works worst. Gotham Ultra might be a tad too black, so you might want to try black or bold and see what you think.
Thanks. I see what you mean about the contrast between Ultra and Black.
